Antialiasing in RGBA Mode

Idea

In RGBA mode one must enable blending. The blending factors typically used are GL_SRC_ALPHA for the source and GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA for the destination. Alternatively, GL_ONE may be used for the destination factor to make the lines brighter where they intersect. The anti- aliased effect is most noticeable if one uses a high alpha value.
